rattle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if you rattle something, or if it rattles, it shakes and makes a quick series of short sounds
rattle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Dan banged on her door and rattled the handle.
The window rattled in the wind.
Bottles rattled as he stacked the beer crates.
rattle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if a vehicle rattles somewhere, it travels there while making a rattling sound
rattle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The cart rattled along the stony road.
An old blue van rattled into view.
rattle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to make someone lose confidence or become nervous
rattle.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: His mocking smile rattled her more than his anger.
It was hard not to get rattled when the work piled up.
His confidence was rattled by the accident.
rattle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a short repeated sound, made when something shakes
rattle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: They listened anxiously to every rattle and creak in the house.
the faint rattle of distant gunfire
rattle.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a babyâ€™s toy that makes a noise when it is shaken
rattle.translation[1].definitions[2].def: an object that people shake to make a loud noise and show excitement or encouragement, for example at ceremonies or sports games
